title: Ranking member of the Energy and Commerce Committee doesn't know where oil comes

content: and a transcript of those to lazy to copypaste Barton: Dr. Chu, I don't wanna leave you out, you're our... you're our scientist. I have one simple question for you in the last six seconds. How did all the oil and gas get to Alaska and under the Arctic Ocean? Chu: [Nervous-sounding laughter] This is... this is a complicated story, but, but oil and gas is the result of hundreds of millions of years of geology, and in that time also the plates have moved around, and so it's the combination of where the sources of the oil and gas are... Barton (interrupting): Well, I mean, isn't it obvious that at one time it was a lot warmer in Alaska and on the north pole? It wasn't a big pipeline that we created in Texas and shipped it up there and put it underground so we could now pump it out and ship it back. Chu: No. There are... there's continental plates that have been drifting around throughout the geological ages... Barton (interrupting): So it just drifted up there? Chu: That's certainly what happened. And so it's the result of things like that.

content: xnavycg: quote: Well, that is a lot more believable than millions on years (earth is only about 6000 years old) and plate tectonics (not in the Bible). Who cares if it's NOT in the Bible? The bible is silent on MANY Issues..but it does speak about earthquakes..so I'm curious what do you think is the cause of earthquakes? I take it you, like apparently this idiot referenced in the conversation didn't learn these things in science??? Maybe this will help.. "http://www.weatherwizkids.com/earthquake1.htm" quote: There are about 20 plates along the surface of the earth that move continuously and slowly past each other. When the plates squeeze or stretch, huge rocks form at their edges and the rocks shift with great force, causing an earthquake. As the plates move they put forces on themselves and each other. When the force is large enough, the crust is forced to break. When the break occurs, the stress is released as energy which moves through the Earth in the form of waves, which we feel and call an earthquake.
quote: Well, that is a lot more believable than millions on years (earth is only about 6000 years old) and plate tectonics (not in the Bible).

content: Hmmm ... the KJV of the Bible doesn't specifically mention electricity or atomic power or space travel or automobiles or (more pointedly, given the method of this discussion) cyber-communication. So where do those things, along with zillions of others, come from? Is it really anathema to eat pork, now that we know uncooked or undercooked pork is the cause of certain diseases? I find those who interpret the Bible literally - each having a different/preferred version, of course - absolutely fascinating.

content: and a transcript of those to lazy to copypaste Barton: Dr. Chu, I don't wanna leave you out, you're our... you're our scientist. I have one simple question for you in the last six seconds. How did all the oil and gas get to Alaska and under the Arctic Ocean? Chu: [Nervous-sounding laughter] This is... this is a complicated story, but, but oil and gas is the result of hundreds of millions of years of geology, and in that time also the plates have moved around, and so it's the combination of where the sources of the oil and gas are... Barton (interrupting): Well, I mean, isn't it obvious that at one time it was a lot warmer in Alaska and on the north pole? It wasn't a big pipeline that we created in Texas and shipped it up there and put it underground so we could now pump it out and ship it back. Chu: No. There are... there's continental plates that have been drifting around throughout the geological ages... Barton (interrupting): So it just drifted up there? Chu: That's certainly what happened. And so it's the result of things like that.

content: xnavycg: quote: Well, that is a lot more believable than millions on years (earth is only about 6000 years old) and plate tectonics (not in the Bible). Who cares if it's NOT in the Bible? The bible is silent on MANY Issues..but it does speak about earthquakes..so I'm curious what do you think is the cause of earthquakes? I take it you, like apparently this idiot referenced in the conversation didn't learn these things in science??? Maybe this will help.. "http://www.weatherwizkids.com/earthquake1.htm" quote: There are about 20 plates along the surface of the earth that move continuously and slowly past each other. When the plates squeeze or stretch, huge rocks form at their edges and the rocks shift with great force, causing an earthquake. As the plates move they put forces on themselves and each other. When the force is large enough, the crust is forced to break. When the break occurs, the stress is released as energy which moves through the Earth in the form of waves, which we feel and call an earthquake.

content: Clearly, without the testimony before, everything is out of Context, and the information could not have been imparted in a week, much les 6 sec. and they both knew it. BTW, oil is from any decayed life TRAPPED IN THE RIGHT CONDITIONS. HOWEVER, mostly it is from ancient algy that lived in shallow seas when the CO2 was a MUCH larger part of the aTMOSPHERE, SAY ABOUT 5,000 PARTS PER MILION, rather than the paltry 385 +-parts per million today. Not to mention the VAST VAST deposits of natural gas that's everywhere.

content: Hmmm ... the KJV of the Bible doesn't specifically mention electricity or atomic power or space travel or automobiles or (more pointedly, given the method of this discussion) cyber-communication. So where do those things, along with zillions of others, come from? Is it really anathema to eat pork, now that we know uncooked or undercooked pork is the cause of certain diseases? I find those who interpret the Bible literally - each having a different/preferred version, of course - absolutely fascinating.
